metadata.title: USN-3061-1 -- OpenSSH vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Eddie Harari discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled password hashing when authenticating non-existing users. A remote attacker could perform a timing attack and enumerate valid users. (CVE-2016-6210)  Tomas Kuthan, Andres Rojas, and Javier Nieto discovered that OpenSSH did not limit password lengths. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSH to consume resources, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2016-6515)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3061-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  openssh-server-udeb - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 openssh-client-udeb - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.8 No subscription required
